name: Information Security Program

procedures.name: Organizational Concepts
procedures.body:
<Var keyName="companyName"/> makes use of cloud services and infrastructure. The network components and supporting network infrastructure are contained within the cloud service provider's infrastructures and managed by the provider. <Var keyName="companyName"/> does not have physical access to the network components.

Within the <Var keyName="companyName"/> platform and supporting services all data storage and transmission is encrypted. <Var keyName="companyName"/> assumes data may contain ePHI, PHI, or PII and provides appropriate protections based on that assumption.

<Var keyName="companyName"/> has implemented access controls and only authorized personnel is given access to the Productions environments. The database servers and/or data repositories, where the ePHI, PHI, or PII resides, can only be accessed through a secure connection. For more info, please read the [Identity and Access Management Policy](/policies/identity-access-management/show).

procedures.name: Risk Assessments
procedures.body: Risk assessments are conducted at least annually to identify existing and potential safeguards to mitigate foreseeable risks to covered assets. Risk assessments are used to inform the selection and implementation of safeguards. Identified risks without mitigating or compensating safeguards are documented and tracked in a central risk registry according to the [Risk Management Policy](/policies/risk-management/show).

procedures.name: Frequency of Policy Review
procedures.body:
In the <Var keyName="companyName"/> Information Security Program, policies, procedures, and controls are reviewed regularly. This should happen at least annually or when a significant event causes the need for a policy change.

It is the responsibility of the Chief Information Security Officer and the Chief Privacy Officer to maintain this policy and ensure the contents of the policy are continually monitored and enforced.

procedures.name: Contact with Authorities
procedures.body: Appropriate contact with relevant authorities must be maintained. Remember when adapting this control to think about the legal responsibilities for communicating with authorities such as the Police, the Information Commissioner's Office, or other regulatory bodies e g. around GDPR. Consider how that contact is to be made, by whom, under what circumstances, and the nature of the information to be provided.
